td.content: s:white female aged 48 years presents with moderate nausea. she also reports mild vomiting, severe headache, Traumatic Injury - Blunt associated with the moderate nausea. a short time ago she sustained a blow to the back of the head (51 min LOC) o:Height 167 cm, Weight 54.4 kg, Temperature 37.1 C, Pulse 85, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 16, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, MRI Brain Unremarkable, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Flexeril - 10 mg po q 8 hrs PRN pain/cramps, performed CT Head, MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:female marine aged 48 Ys returns for f/u approx. one (1) week s/p concussion with LOC 51 min. denies vomiting, headache and nausea. First 24-hour hourly checks were without incident. o:Height 167 cm, Weight 54.1 kg, Temperature 37.1 C, Pulse 85, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 71, Respiration 15, MRI Brain Unremarkable, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes). No sequelae p:performed MRI Brain, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.
